The audio doesn't start for about a minute, which might be why people think there's no audio (and, for a TS/CAM, the audio is really quite good)...
The video is permanently "boxed in", so that even in FULLSCREEN mode, the video frame only occupies about 3/4 of your screen.  If (in VLC) you change the aspect ratio to 16:9 or 16:10, then toggle to fullscreen mode, you can mostly eliminate this, but it is still a pain in the ass--especially when compared to the "non-boxed" video of the "TS.XviD-SceneLovers" version (whose audio is maybe slightly inferior to this one).
